title: Carl W. Hansen
text:
Carl Werner Hansen (born in <a href="Slagelse">Slagelse</a>), commonly known as Carl W. Hansen, is a <a href="Denmark">Danish</a> former <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Referee%20%28association%20football%29">referee</a> and <a href="Assistant%20referee%20%28association%20football%29">linesman</a>, who officiated in the Danish top-flight, second-tier and third-tier including lower ranking leagues in the 1950s and 1960s and in both European and <a href="UEFA">UEFA</a> sanctioned club tournaments. From 1962 until 1969, he was a <a href="List%20of%20FIFA%20international%20referees">full international</a> for <a href="FIFA">FIFA</a>, and officiated international <a href="Exhibition%20game">friendlies</a> and competitive games at senior, secondary 'B' team and under-19 level.
Career.
Born in Slagelse, Hansen became affiliated with the <a href="DBU%20Zealand">Zealand FA</a> (SBU) and the regional referee organisation, "Sjællands Fodbolddommer-Union" (SFU), as a referee, originally officiating lower ranking league matches at a regional level for the football association organising football on <a href="Zealand">Zealand</a>. He eventually moved up to a national level under the auspices of the <a href="Danish%20Football%20Association">Danish FA</a>, supervising numerous top-tier Danish league games including cup matches in the 1950s and 1960s in a role as <a href="Assistant%20referee%20%28association%20football%29">linesman</a> and referee. He started officiating third-tier league matches sometime in the early 1950s, before moving up to second-tier and top-flight league games. Carl W. Hansen was assigned the role as <a href="Assistant%20referee%20%28association%20football%29">linesman</a> for the <a href="1959%20Danish%20Cup%20Final">1959 Danish Cup Final</a>'s replay match between <a href="Aarhus%20Gymnastikforening">Aarhus GF</a> and <a href="Vejle%20Boldklub">Vejle BK</a>. In the <a href="1961%E2%80%9362%20European%20Cup">1961–62 European Cup</a> semi-final match between <a href="Tottenham%20Hotspur%20F.C.">Tottenham Hotspur F.C.</a> versus <a href="S.L.%20Benfica">S.L. Benfica</a>, he served as a linesmen with <a href="Aage%20Poulsen%20%28referee%29">Aage Poulsen</a> as the referee in the match. After having officiated the <a href="1963%E2%80%9364%20Danish%20Cup">1963–64 Danish Cup</a> semi-final match in late April 1964 between <a href="Akademisk%20Boldklub">Akademisk BK</a> and <a href="Esbjerg%20fB">Esbjerg fB</a>, he was also designated the <a href="1964%20Danish%20Cup%20Final">1964 Danish Cup Final</a>, featuring <a href="Esbjerg%20fB">Esbjerg fB</a> and <a href="KFUMs%20Boldklub%20Odense">Odense KFUM</a>, as the referee by the <a href="Danish%20Football%20Association">Danish FA</a>. He ended his domestic refereeing career in the top three league levels sometime in late 1969 or early 1970s, when he exceeded the then domestic age limit rule of 50 years.
He was appointed to the <a href="FIFA%20International%20Referees%20List">FIFA List</a> on 24 June 1962 by the Danish FA as part of the association's then seven man large group of referees, appointed yearly, and could effectively start refereeing international matches beginning from 1 July 1962. He refereed several <a href="Exhibition%20game">friendlies</a> and international competitive games. His international assignments has included refereeing the match between <a href="Norway%20national%20football%20team">Norway</a> and <a href="Finland%20national%20football%20team">Finland</a> on 20 August 1964 as part of the <a href="1964%E2%80%9367%20Nordic%20Football%20Championship">1964–67 Nordic Football Championship</a>, serving as a linesman at the 'B' team friendly between Denmark and Sweden on 5 November 1966 and being a linesman at the Under-19 friendly between <a href="Denmark%20national%20under-19%20football%20team">Denmark</a> and <a href="Norway%20national%20under-19%20football%20team">Norway</a> on 1 October 1960. He ended his tenure as FIFA referee in June 1969.
